wikipedia_page.main: David Reeder (May 5, 1931 – August 1, 2005) was a British historian at the University of Leicester. After graduating from Nunthorpe Grammar School he won a scholarship at the University of Durham, where he served as Editor of Palatinate. He was a member of Hatfield College, where he was Captain of Table Tennis in 1950. Reeder took his PhD at the University of Leicester. He pursued a career in urban history and the history of education, co-founding the Urban History Group and editing the Urban History Yearbook for nine years.

response: * David Reeder (Hatfield) – Lecturer in Urban History, University of Leicester

He was promoted to Professor of Urban History at the University of Leicester in 1973, but it was a personal title; there was no department of urban history. He founded the Urban History Newsletter in 1963.Biographical note, p. 910 of H. J. Dyos, Michael Wolff, The Victorian City: Images and Realities (1999). The Newsletter was largely replaced by the Urban History Yearbook from 1974, which later became Urban History. His students included David Reeder;The Independenthttp://www.le.ac.uk/press/ebulletin/features/urbanhistory.html he influenced others, including David Cannadine.
*Exploring the Urban Past: Essays in Urban History edited by David Cannadine and David Reeder (1982)
* David Reeder  [1942–49], historian of education and town planning.
